answers.answer: I am not sure about the recurrance, but because you were high risk before, they will probably treat you as if you are high risk next time . . . increased appointments and high risk ultrasound monitoring . .  .

I was not high risk until week 35, up until then absolutely nothing was wrong, not even morning sickness!  But I had my daughter at 36 weeks via emergency c-section...it all went so fast, everything went wrong within 24 hours...I had a dr. appt the day before and everything was fine.

question: Hi, during my last pregnancy I had Preeclampia, Marginal insertion of the umbilical cord into the placenta, and HELLP Syndrome.  Because of these three things we ended up having a preemie girl who weighed 3 lbs 14 oz at birth.  Does anyone know if these things tend to re-occur or is it just something that happend?  I am by no means overweight...I am 5'3" 120 lbs so the fact that I even experienced preeclampsia was mind boggling to my dr.Does anyone know if I am going to be a high risk pregnancy next time around?  I am 26 yrs old.
title: Marginal Insertion of the Cord, Preeclampsia, HELLP Syndrome re-occurance
